title: RPCDaemon passes zero gasPrice to eth_call EVM execution
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: 2021.08.4-alpha

OS & Version: Linux Ubuntu 20.04.2 LTS

Commit hash : [0a887fd](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/commit/0a887fdb63d8760f0ec24bba890618dbf5ac4e76)

#### Expected behaviour
Response to eth_call API in Goerli testnet is the same using:

Infura (used as reference, its client version is Geth v1.10.6)
RPCDaemon connected to Erigon Core
Silkrpc connected to Erigon Core

#### Actual behaviour
RPCDaemon+Erigon gives a different result from Infura and Sillkrpc+Erigon (which give the same result) executing `eth_call` for the following transaction: [0x2d2eb5044637df2d6d733b958c0f7b3859b75c8ab0bb1533f457553ff4365dbe](https://goerli.etherscan.io/tx/0x2d2eb5044637df2d6d733b958c0f7b3859b75c8ab0bb1533f457553ff4365dbe)

Infura: error execution reverted (same code, data and message as Silkrpc)
Silkrpc: error execution reverted (same code, data and message as Infura)
RPCDaemon: {"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"result":"0x"}

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
- Compare how the three API endpoints (Infura/RPCDaemon/Silkrpc) answer to `eth_call` for such transaction using the following command:

```
curl --silent -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "eth_call", "params": [{"data": "0x13ca4b3b00000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000002540be400","from": "0x3f164d991502e930043292fac5e62e313018125a", "to": "0xcf463b20ab8b33211fbdb0dc5785536601505a86", "gas": "0x1e8480", "gasPrice": "0x2540be400"}, "0x50C954"], "id": 1}' <api_endpoint_url>
```

#### Analysis
Looking at [target contract](https://goerli.etherscan.io/address/0xcf463b20ab8b33211fbdb0dc5785536601505a86) bytecode you can find the encoded revert message returned by Infura/Silkrpc and decompiling the bytecode gives an hint at where the problem lies. Such revert message is returned just in case the `tx.gas_price >= param1` condition is satisfied, where `param1` is the provided call parameter (0x2540be400).
The root cause can be tracked down to the [ToMessage](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/blob/devel/internal/ethapi/api.go#L386) function where `gasPrice` variable shadowing leaves outer scope variable with the same name unassigned resulting eventually in zero gas price passed to the EVM context.
